Thank you so much for this song and everything! I'm so proud of you. I really hope you read this because you really changed my life. I went through similar things as you did in this song and ''Be Alright'' and I really wanted to give up, but your music helped me through so much. I was homeless and busking in the street from the age of 13 until I turned 17 and I listened to so many of your songs. It got me through the night and the day when I walked around the city with my headphones on. I was a runaway teen (home wasn't safe as the streets, that's all I'll say) and I just kept listening to your songs and it inspired me to write my own songs. Then I would perform them in the street for money to buy food. It eventually lead me to being discovered and now I have my own car and house at 19. I know I still got a long way to go, but your new release brought back memories when I listened to your last album walking around the city, wondering if I was ever going to be successful as you. Thank you Dean, thank you so much and I wish you a healthy heart and a lot more success. You deserve it.  - Kal Bear (Kal Wilkinson)
